intro: Conyza anchusifolia, commonly known as the common blueweed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Americas. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, blue to purple flower heads that are surrounded by pale green bracts, which are often mistaken for petals. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and have serrated margins, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Conyza anchusifolia is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in open fields, where it thrives in full sun.
